solvents.name: Ethanol
solvents.density_note: Anhydrous at 20°C. See ethanol_water_density_table for mixture densities.
solvents.safety_notes: Flammable. Not suitable for individuals avoiding alcohol.
solvents.notes: Primary solvent for most tinctures. Higher concentrations favor resins and volatile oils; lower concentrations favor water-soluble constituents.

solvents.name: Water
solvents.density_note: At 20°C, 1 atm. Density varies slightly with temperature.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: No preservative effect. Aqueous preparations spoil within 24-72 hours without refrigeration or preservative.
solvents.safety_notes: Use filtered or distilled water for preparations. Avoid tap water with chlorine for long macerations.
solvents.notes: Universal solvent for polar constituents. Hot water extracts more than cold. Infusions and decoctions are the oldest extraction methods.

solvents.name: Glycerin (Glycerol)
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Preservative at concentrations above ~55%. Moderate shelf life (1-2 years) for glycerites.
solvents.safety_notes: Sweet taste makes glycerites palatable for children and those avoiding alcohol. Ensure food/USP grade.
solvents.notes: Used for glycerites (alcohol-free extracts) and as a secondary solvent in tinctures. Weaker extraction capacity than ethanol but good for tannin-rich herbs. Sweet taste is a formulation advantage.

solvents.name: Acetic Acid (Vinegar)
solvents.density_note: Density of standard 5% acetic acid (white vinegar) at 20°C.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Mild preservative. Aceta (herbal vinegars) last 6-12 months refrigerated.
solvents.safety_notes: Use food-grade apple cider vinegar or white vinegar (5% acidity minimum). Avoid in metal containers.
solvents.notes: Acidic pH converts alkaloid free bases to salts, improving extraction. Especially effective for mineral-rich herbs (nettles, horsetail). Used for aceta and oxymels.

solvents.name: Olive Oil
solvents.density_note: Extra virgin olive oil at 20°C. Varies slightly by cultivar.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Oil infusions last 6-12 months. Vitamin E can extend shelf life. Rancidity is the primary degradation pathway.
solvents.safety_notes: Topical use generally safe. Check for olive allergy. Extra virgin has more antioxidants but stronger flavor.
solvents.notes: The traditional base oil for herbal infused oils and salves. Good stability, moderate cost, widely available. Heavier feel than some alternatives.

solvents.name: Coconut Oil
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: High in saturated fats, very resistant to rancidity. Shelf life 1-2 years for infused oils.
solvents.safety_notes: Generally safe topically. Comedogenic (may clog pores). Use fractionated coconut oil for liquid-state preparations.
solvents.notes: Solid at room temperature (melts at ~24°C). High saturated fat content provides excellent shelf stability. Fractionated coconut oil (MCT) stays liquid.

solvents.name: Jojoba Oil
solvents.density_note: Technically a liquid wax ester, not a triglyceride oil.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Extremely stable â€” does not go rancid easily. Shelf life 3-5 years. Best stability of any carrier oil.
solvents.safety_notes: Generally non-comedogenic. Rarely causes allergic reactions. Not recommended for internal use.
solvents.notes: A liquid wax, not a true oil. Closest to human sebum in composition. Excellent for facial and skin preparations. Premium price point.

solvents.name: Sweet Almond Oil
solvents.density_note: At 20°C. Must be from Prunus dulcis var. amygdalus (sweet), not bitter almond.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Moderate stability. Shelf life 6-12 months for infused oils. Add vitamin E to extend.
solvents.safety_notes: Tree nut allergen. Contraindicated for individuals with nut allergies. Always confirm sweet almond (not bitter).
solvents.notes: Light, well-absorbed carrier oil popular for massage and topical preparations. Good emollient properties. Moderate cost.

solvents.name: Grapeseed Oil
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Shorter shelf life due to high polyunsaturated fat content. 6-9 months. Refrigerate infused oils.
solvents.safety_notes: Generally safe. High in linoleic acid. Lightweight and non-greasy.
solvents.notes: Very light oil, absorbs quickly. Popular for facial preparations. Short shelf life is the main drawback for herbal infusions. High in proanthocyanidins.

solvents.name: Sunflower Oil
solvents.density_note: At 20°C. High-oleic varieties are more stable.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Standard sunflower oil has moderate shelf life (6-9 months). High-oleic sunflower oil is more stable (1-2 years).
solvents.safety_notes: Generally safe. Rare allergenicity. Use high-oleic varieties for best shelf stability in preparations.
solvents.notes: Affordable and widely available. High-oleic sunflower oil is an excellent all-purpose carrier oil with good stability. Rich in vitamin E.

solvents.name: Sesame Oil
solvents.density_note: Untoasted sesame oil at 20°C. Toasted sesame oil has a different flavor profile but similar density.
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Good stability due to natural antioxidants (sesamol, sesamin). Shelf life 9-12 months.
solvents.safety_notes: Sesame allergen. Contraindicated for individuals with sesame allergy. Use untoasted for herbal preparations.
solvents.notes: Traditional base oil in Ayurvedic medicine (taila). Contains natural antioxidants (sesamol, sesamin) that provide good shelf stability. Warming quality in Ayurvedic energetics.

solvents.name: Honey
solvents.density_note: Approximately 1.42 g/mL. Varies with moisture content (typically 15-20% water).
solvents.shelf_life_contribution: Excellent preservative due to low water activity, acidic pH, and hydrogen peroxide production. Honey-based preparations last 1-2 years.
solvents.safety_notes: Do not give to infants under 12 months (botulism risk). Diabetics should account for sugar content. Use raw, unprocessed honey for best antimicrobial properties.
solvents.notes: Used in oxymels (honey + vinegar), electuaries (honey + powdered herbs), and syrups. Provides its own antimicrobial and demulcent properties. Not a primary extraction solvent but an excellent vehicle and preservative.
